ygData.messageBody:
At 15.13 16/05/99 +0100, you wrote:
>From: Simon Hinshelwood <iktome@...>
>
>Dear Gregory,
>
>You hit he nail on the head, how many times have we seen a /shout for a
>wizard..never. Verant need to do something about the mages, enchanters and
>wizards. I think Ken has a point, combine the lot into one.

I think that a wizard is most hindered one i dont know if on realy high lvs
40 + you have advantages for your weeknes with wich we start but other
magic classes are much stronger at early levels like until 20.


> When Verant split
>them it sounded a great idea, I thought it was at the time too. But, the
>reality is quite different, unfortunately.

The main problem is that our class in not ovious time saver as i can say a
cleric saves downtime by faster healing, a bard also can do it a druid not
only this but can make for faster onland travel and is strong at DD and
majority of players is not near lv where wizard start to be useful as lv
when you have group travel. Only solution for this is some type of skill
advancment where you can choose at a creation of caracter some skills wich
will you develop throu play like AC but this is to be seen as it is
implemented. But i like to see this idea also only we must admit that
classes are not finalized until now, lets say magicians pets after 20 lv
where out of game research comes a little time ago, specizlization on wich
we look as last chance to save a gameplay for us is not implemented yet.
there is much to see and maybe it will look as good as it is in
introduction book :-)

The class solution against skill solutions can be made better, now there
are many many holes in sistem wich will need a time to get closed only is a
problem to see how many people will wait until then?

>
>
>Simon
>
>
>
>
>Gregory Egan wrote:
>
>> From: Gregory Egan <gemd@...>
>>
>> I was attracted to playing a wizard by the way the class was described in
>> the game's manual, but if I had to do it over again (and I won't because I
>> have already put a lot of time into my character, and want to play with my
>> friends who are of the same level as I), I would pick a druid or shaman
>> type character. They have great spells, which can also be cast on other
>> party members, and aren't so weak in weapons and AC as wizards are. I hate
>> it when I tell my friends about the spells I can get, only to find out they
>> can be cast only on myself (shielding, resistant skin, etc.) My ranger
>> friend casts Skin like Wood on my all the time, I have nothing to
>> reciprocate. I think wizards as a class are short changed, and have never
>> seen anyone do a /shout looking for a wizard to join with them as they do
>> for rangers, shamans, bards, etc. Just my 2 cents.
>>
